content:
Psychology is the scientific study of the mind and behavior. It encompasses a wide range of topics, including the biological basis of behavior, perception, learning, memory, emotion, personality, and mental disorders. Behavioral psychology focuses on the study of observable behaviors, particularly as they relate to learning and conditioning. Cognitive psychology, on the other hand, focuses on internal mental processes such as problem-solving, memory, perception, and language. Which of the following is not typically a focus of psychology?
A. The study of the mind and behavior
B. The study of observable behaviors
C. The study of internal mental processes
D. The study of personality and mental disorders
E. The study of plant biology

E. The study of plant biology is not typically a focus of psychology. Psychology is primarily concerned with the study of the mind and behavior in humans and animals, but not plants. The study of plant biology falls under the domain of botany or plant science.
